text: <@U231ZGXDG|shukla> has joined the channel
<@U23GLSTS4|jlamiel> has joined the channel
I found sawtooth-* repos were merged into sawtooth-core, so  we  should develop on sawtooth-core repo, not develop on  other independent sawtooth-* repos now?
<@U1ZUSJHAA>: right
<http://lists.hyperledger.org/pipermail/hyperledger-stl/2016-August/000014.html>
<@U0YQQRNU8> Thanks for your kind help. I subscribed to hyperledger-stl mailing list.
<@U20A6GBT3|jzou3700> has joined the channel
Hi <@U20A6GBT3> :slightly_smiling_face:
when did you clone your repos?
just moments ago
great
Sorry, I clone it yesterday, but run vagrant up  2 hours before
<@U23T4Q88L> are you already on this channel?
<@U23T4Q88L|shuanglu> has joined the channel

<@U20A6GBT3> can you run this for me and put the output in the chat: 
ls /project/sawtooth-core/core/build
lib.linux-x86_64-2.7 temp.linux-x86_64-2.7

ok, good.  Now please run
cd /project/sawtooth-core/bin
./txnvalidator
Hope there is no typor, since the sawtooh on the other machine. I cannot copy and paste
Same issue got
ok, please paste the whole stack trace here for me in a snippet
oh sorry, you just said you can't cut and paste.
please type as much of the error here as you can.
I have connected the sawtooth machine with ssh from locale

vagrant@vagrant-ubuntu-trusty-64:/project/sawtooth-core$ ./bin/txnvalidator
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./bin/txnvalidator", line 18, in <module>
    from txnmain.validator_cli import main_wrapper
  File "/project/sawtooth-validator/txnmain/validator_cli.py", line 25, in <module>
    from sawtooth.config import ArgparseOptionsConfig
ImportError: No module named sawtooth.config

ok, thanks.  Please run this and paste the response for me:
echo $PYTHONPATH

vagrant@vagrant-ubuntu-trusty-64:/project/sawtooth-core$ echo $PYTHONPATH
/project/sawtooth-core:/project/sawtooth-core/build/lib.linux-x86_64-2.7:/project/sawtooth-mktplace:/project/sawtooth-validator:/project/sawtooth-arcade
ahhhh I see.
you probably launched vagrant from sawtooth-dev-tools right?
Sorry, this is because of the repo restructure.  Here's what you should do...
exit from vagrant.  then...
vagrant destroy
(may have to force it)
vagrant destroy --force
OK done
great.  now please go into sawtooth-core/tools
and run 'vagrant up' from within there.
waiting for download now
ok.
It's time for our lunch and long initiative time. I should leave with colleagues. Really appreciate your kindly guidance and I will be back   in 1 hour.
Ok, have a nice lunch.  I believe this will work.  Apologies if I am not on when you return.
Please find the corrected tutorial here: <https://github.com/hyperledger/sawtooth-core/blob/master/docs/source/tutorial.rst>

attachments.title: hyperledger/sawtooth-core
attachments.text: sawtooth-core - Core repository for Sawtooth Lake Distributed ledger

text:
Hi <@U0VKPD6A2> i’m trying to go through the tutorial for sawtooth and I had some basic questions that I could really use assistance on- 
1. What sawtooth repo should I be using? Right now i’m using the modules under intelledger/ from the release on Mar 31st/v1.1.0. However this release seems to not behave as expected when I do what’s mentioned on the tutorial. For instance -v(verbose) is not included in validator_cli.py among a few more minor things. I tried to fill in aspects that I thought were missing or needed but I don’t want to spend too much time doing that if I can get quicker solutions for it. Am I using the right version of the repo?
2. Trying to use the validator CLI using launcher.py and save-blockchain and load-blockchain. This script launches x number of validators on the machine and then tries to export state. In context of the tutorial how can I export the blocks I have on a single validator? How can I use save-blockchain/load-blockchain on a single existing validator.
3. Finally i know this is an ongoing process but i’m trying to make sure i’m using the latest documentation on this so is there a better place than <https://intelledger.github.io> for this?

Thanks!
<@U0N3AJSSU>
In retrospect it seems there’s some answers in <#C0J02NU1E|general> but please let me know if i’m not doing this right.
thanks.

jzou@redpanda:~/hyperledger/sawtooth-core/core$ python setup.py build
/home/jzou/.local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/setuptools/dist.py:364: UserWarning: Normalizing '1.1.1-dev1' to '1.1.1.dev1'
